channel.title: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response? – Politepix

item.title: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response?
item.dc:creator: boombatz
item.description:
Hi,
I thought I read this somewhere in the doc’s but now I can’t find it. I want to start listening and if I haven’t heard anything in five seconds then say something like “I don’t hear you”
Is there an existing method or parameter that will help me do this?
Thanks.

item.title: Reply To: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response?
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: This is something that you would want to handle in your own app logic, perhaps with an NSTimer.

item.title: Reply To: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response?
item.dc:creator: boombatz

item.title: Reply To: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response?
item.dc:creator: boombatz
item.description:
HI,
I can’t seem to download the extra voices from bitbucket. I’m logged in and pretty sure I’m doing it correctly. Are they available from another source?

Here’s the log.
18:50:24 git import for: https://bitbucket.org/Politepix/openearsextras/src/9f15cdb9e746732402e928424a46debb9d79ecc7?at=master
18:50:24 Cloning https://bitbucket.org/Politepix/openearsextras/src/9f15cdb9e746732402e928424a46debb9d79ecc7?at=master…
18:50:24 Cloning into bare repository ‘BobbySch/9f15cdb9e746732402e928424a46debb9d79ecc7at-master’…
18:50:24 fatal: https://bitbucket.org/Politepix/openearsextras/src/9f15cdb9e746732402e928424a46debb9d79ecc7?at=master/info/refs not valid: is this a git repository?
18:50:25 Remote Git clone failed: <class ‘bitbucket.apps.async.tasks.ImportException’>: Command failed. Return value: 128

item.title: Reply To: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response?
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: Sorry, that sounds like a git or a bitbucket issue. I think bitbucket support is probably the way to go.

item.title: Reply To: Can I tell how long my app was waiting for a response?
